API¶

The Test Case¶

Base classes for black box tests - one for pytest and one for unittest derived tests.

The base classes should be identical so unittest users and pytest users will get the exact same services from the infrastructure.

class bbtest.testcases.BBPytest[source]¶

Base class for black box tests for pytest tests.

The setup/teardown methods within this class should be called from fixtures. A default conftest file with default fixtures can be found under the tests sample folder.

We’ve added a class property topo that holds a dictionary defining the lab environment. Each test case can define a topo property used to setup a lab and store it in self.lab.

address_book = {}¶

Clean black box testing lab after test cases.

class bbtest.testcases.BBTestCase(methodName='runTest')[source]¶

A black box test case based on unittest.TestCase

unitest calls the setup/teardown classes within this base class automatically.

We’ve added a class property topo that holds a dictionary defining the lab enviornment. Each test case can define a topo property used to setup a lab and store it in self.lab.

The Black Box¶

To take part in a test a component needs to be wrapped in a BlackBox.

class bbtest.blackboxes.BlackBox(host, name=None)[source]¶

This is an abstract class used to wrap a component in a black box. Black boxes can then be used to test the component itself and to verify it integrates well with other components. A blackbox runs on a host and you can communicate with it using host.run

install(package=None, version=None)[source]¶

Install bbtes=Nonet tests package on remote host.

Parameters:
  • package – bbtest tests package to install. If None do not install
  • version – package version to install, if None install latest
